content.detailedDescription:
Here is the exact post i made on my nfl forums fan site about 45 minutes after seeing the object (my username, as admin of the site, is pantherfan007):

__________________________

select this post for moderation posted 16 july 2008 - 12:19 pm 

i was just sitting on my front deck talking on the phone to my sister as i sometimes do during the day, smoking a cigarette and minding my own business (more or less...Lol), when i saw the craziest thing i've ever seen.

first of all, let me say this, i live not far from charlotte, perhaps 15 miles from charlotte airport as the crow flies, so i often take a break and sit out here watching planes flying to and from the airport. that's normal and a usual routine for me.

because i was talking on the phone and otherwise distracted, i wasn't paying attention to planes or anything else. the sky is particularly blue and clear other than a few puffy clouds here and there, but something flashing in the sky (like a mirror reflecting) caught my eye as i was talking to my sister.

i inadvertently watched the object, thinking it to be an airliner headed towards charlotte. there was something odd about it, though, because even though it was long and silver shaped, i couldn't see any wings on it, but it was definitely flashing as if it were rotating in flight and reflecting the sunlight (like a cigar spinning). i stopped talking to her for a moment, watched the object (which was large and very visible), when it suddenly disappeared as if it just faded out of view. i was stumped and completely lost my train of thought.

i interrupted my sister and told her what i had seen and was describing it to her, and about three or four seconds after it "disappeared", there was a flash of silver streak as it reappeared and zoomed back in the opposite direction, 180 degrees from the direction it had been traveling. this thing went completely out of site within a split second. that's the part that floored me more than anything else. again, speechless, i stumbled for words and finally told her it had just reappeared and had zoomed out of site the opposite direction.

within five minutes a military awaks type of aircraft (the ones with what looks like a large satellite dish on their back) came from the direction of charlotte and flew to the same area which i had seen the... thing... disappear. in comparison, this thing i saw was at least three times larger than the awaks plane and it had no wings whatsoever, just a long cylinder shape.

anyways, i had to tell somebody, and you can laugh if you want to, i would if it were me reading it instead of having just seen it happen.

________________________________

here is the link showing the timestamp:

http://www.Panthersfanz.Com/forums/index.Php?Showtopic=14438&st=0

___________________________________

as far as my feelings or reaction, i was stumped, dazed, and was a little shocked that this had happened to me in broad daylight.  

as my post stated, what originally brought the object to my attention was flashes coming from it, appearing as if the sun was reflecting off a mirror or something.  as i looked towards it, i first thought it was a very large airplane, but immediately noticed the revolving or rotational movement of it.  

my first thought, for a split second, was that it was a plane in trouble and that it was going to crash (due to the rotation of it), but as it rotated, i realized there were no wings on the object.  as funny as this sounds, i was about to consider it to be a blimp (even though it was traveling too fast), when it literally faded from blue into the clear blue sky.  the reason i say "faded" is because that is exactly as it appeared.  it took approximately 1 - 2 seconds for it to fade from view, but it did not "instantly" disappear.  

i blurted out something, interrupting my sister's phone conversation, and told her what i had just seen.  about three to four seconds later, before she could finish making a joke about it, the object reappeared and in a flash it zipped out of site 180 degrees in the opposite direction.  nothing "we" have could fly as fast as that thing flew.  

there was no sound involved, although when it reappeared and flew in the opposite direction it left a sort of short trail from where it originated.  it was not like a cloud trail, but more of a vapor or heat trail, which quickly faded from view.

all that said, i can promise you as a grown man (and owner of that nfl fan site), i would never have made such a post and risk ridicule had it not affected me so much and had it not happened.  

thanks for listening.

dewayne gore
content.summary: Large silver cigar shaped object, revolving with flashes coming from it

content.detailedDescription: I was driving around 5:10 this morning drving west and i look up,well i didn't have to look up that far and i saw i thought a star.I was thinking that the star was very low.I just kept asking my self "why is the star so low?"i ended up pooling over and i was watching it and all of a sudden it grew big and red lights were around the back of it and it looked like it was moving towards me then it stopped and shrinks up like itwas before and the red lights went away.Itwasstill there so i drive further down the road and i pulled over again andit lit up and moved again same as the other time but it moved into another direction.It looked just like a star.I got to my distanation and it was still there by 5:40.I'm not sure when it left.It looked just like a star.
content.summary: Looked just like a star except when it moved it got brighter and red lights went aroun the back of it

content.detailedDescription:
on the evening of 7 sep 09 at 21:10, a friend from work and i saw a very bright red object in the sky approximately 10 degrees below the planet jupiter.  we had been on a bike ride along los gatos creek trail and had finished on the bridge in campbell park.  we had been here several times before learning the constellations and watching for satellites after sunset. 
   i noticed a bright red object which was stationery in the sky.  i realized it couldn't be mars, it wasn't a plane's tail light (it didn't move, but it was that brightness and color), and it couldn't be a helicopter as there was no sound or movement.  very small white moving dots (pin points of light) became visible near it.  they seemed to be interacting with it.  my friend took picture with iphone.
   after a few minutes it began to pulsate in brightness, then it began changing from red to white and back to red every 10 secs or so. at about 21:22 it faded out completely and did not return.  the small white dots continued to be visible for a few minutes after the red object vanished.
   we were stunned and did not know what to do.  i wanted to notify someone but whom? found mufon on-line.
content.summary: Bright, red, star-like object pulsated in sky 12 mins turned white,then faded

content.detailedDescription:
1. i was getting ready to go to sleep.

2. every night before i go to sleep i sit in bed and watch airliners fly to and from the minneapolis-st.Paul airport. i thought it was just an aircraft traveling along. but the thing that struck the object to be odd was the fact that it had no blinking lights.

3. i thought it was nothing but the fact that there was no blinking lights that struck it to be odd.

4. it first looked to be an aircraft at about 20,000 - 30,000 ft. it was traveling at 400-500 mph. then out of no where it just increases to tremendous speeds. it looked as if it hit the speed if light or even greater. because as it increased in speed it left a light trail that looked like it was in the shape of an arch. the light was a cobalt blue with a white hue. and as it disappeared it released a very bright light. the light was looked as if you starred at a star for awhile and you saw the light rays. i could say it looked like the star in the stories of the northern star in the stories of jesus being born. and the arch of light vanished into the light explosion. what was also weird was the fact that the light arch followed its shape into the light explosion. also if you are familiar with star wars and the millenium falcon. it looked like what the millenium falcon looks like when it hits hyper space. it was beautiful.

5. i felt as if it was other worldy. also i have the feeling that i shouldn't go to sleep. also as a note; i was in the air force and i have seen some pretty amazing stuff but nothing like that. i also felt amazement. i also felt sadness as to the point that no one else would probably ever see that. it was awe inspiring.  

6. it disappeared.
content.summary: Fast moving ufo headed south at about 20,000 - 30,000 ft or greater.

content.detailedDescription: About 11;30 pm i had just went to bed and was looking out the window toward the north, stars were out but no moon, i was listening to the radio, i was almost 15 years old at the time so i wasn't really sleepy and as i looked out the window this light, a neon blue colored light lite up and in the middle i could make out a brighter white flat shaped disc as it flew over our house going north, i first was amazed at the neon light that flooded the whole area an the bedroom too. i thought maybe aa air force jet but there was no sound at all. my dad was outside when this occured and i heard him come back in and he came to my door, because he figured i was still awake as i had just went to bed and he asked me "did you see that?" and that was it. we lived at the end of a county road in east tenn. near virginia and north carolina at foot of a mountain, way back. id seen lots of jets and low flying air force doing training i suppose many times thru the years as the tried to evade radar toward oak ridge etc.. or so my brothers would say so i was familiar with such stuff and this fit none of the above. i have seen other things that i won't include here but if your profilers are interested in them i would gladly relate them. there had been other type's of events that would require alot more typing on my part but may be worth relating. possible close contact "things" have occurred but don't want to be seen as "another one of those" because it did occur and sometimes i do feel like they're still around if you know what i mean. i know it's been a long time since this report happened and i never contacted anyone but its been in my mind since then and the events since then and now have added to my curiosity of what it all means and i guess you guys have heard it all and may have a clue or two that i can add to the mix to get a better understanding of what is happening and especially why. no ive never seen, talked too or knowingly been in contact with any alien being but i do know what i have seen is not from our technology or anyone else's...Just impossible, especially in 1969 or today. i had been interested in "ufo's" prior to this event and as a young kid was facsinated at the idea but was kinda scared to acually see something this grand, eerie spooky sort of feeling at the time. but as i said other things happened afterwards and my brothers and neighbors have seen some things too and they could verify some of the same occurances. im much older now and more concerned than curious, ive seen and read through the years and i keep an open mind reguarding people's accounts, some are obvious illusion's and attention device's, hoax's etc.. but a few are the real deal, don't ask me how i know but it seems to me i just feel when its truthful and it gives me a twinge when i read or see such a report.
content.summary: Flat round with neon blue light passed overhead, low altitude, no sound

content.detailedDescription: We were coming home from a movie at 8:45 heading north and noticed to our right (east) a bright large object.  it took us about 10 seconds to enter our street toward our home heading east and saw that it was cigar shaped and light orange. one person thought it appeared more white than light orange. it was cloudy out and had rained/drizzled so we thought this could not be the moon as the moon would have been blacked out by clouds and not a perfect shape as this was. we both said that is no plane, not the moon and is that a ufo? then, in less than a minute we ran into our house grabbed a cell phone and took a couple of shots. one party saw by the time we took photo it had turned white.  the other party grabbed batteries for another camera, and in about one minute it was two lights. it did not move like the planes we often see that direction as dia is east/ north east of us.  we went upstairs and looked out east and one person saw it faintly head north/north east.  this all happened in about 5 minutes.  we also noticed there were no blinking lights as the airplanes have.  it was very very large to us, but was far away.  we were calm, a little surprised to see this and it all happened so very fast.
content.summary: Driving home in littleton, facing east, north east we saw  cigar shaped bright very large object, it was orange when we first saw it, it turned to two white lights in about a minute as we entered our home, went our back & took  photo. it left north east.

content.detailedDescription: It came out of the south west went almost right above ulysses but just to the north of it in a north east heading till out of sight.It was the same brightness all the time it didn't turn or get any lower. it was moving faster then most jets but there was no noise.This didn't look like a meteor or a satellite or an aircraft it was bright and looked about the same size as a street light but almost to bright to look at and there wasn't a trail left behind it.
content.summary: It came out of the south west when almost right above ulysses but just to the north of it in a north east heading till out of sight.

content.detailedDescription:
I'm near the ca-or border, and was at the yreka walmart at about 6:45pm(still daylight), when i noticed a silvery flash about a 500 yards away, and about 500 ft high..
at first glance i thought it was a large rectangular piece offoil catching the light..
it stayed in one place for about 3 minutes, then it moved up, down, sideways, at about which time my daughter(22), and mother(82) approached the car..
i quickly said," look at that!"
they watched with me and speculated it must be aluminum foil, but the object moved south to the hills and as it moved up and down it looked like something performing a search pattern..
they were still sceptical as we watched the object drop into a shaded draw..
then things got very interesting because even though everything around it was shaded, this object was still shiny and reflective like sun on polished chrome..
eventually it moved in back of the low-lying hills, and was gone..
wish i had a cam-corder..
content.summary: Just south of yreka walmart, watched silvery, flashy object for 15 min.

content.detailedDescription:
I was walking toward my apartment on monday night, 9/7/09 at about 9:15 pm with my son.  i happened to look up because the night was clear and there were a lot of stars.  a boomerang shape set of lights was moving directly over our heads and i told my son to look up and as i looked closer i could see the outline of a boomerang shaped object.  it silently glided across the sky heading toward the south.  it took about 5 seconds before it was blocked from sight by the treeline.  

my initial reaction was shock and i was stunned because i never thought i would ever see anything like that.  my son verified that he saw it also, although his first reaction was it was geese.  while geese may fly at night, they fly in more of a v formation, and i've always seen them with one side shorter than the other.  this was not a very narrow v (less than 90 degree angle), it was wider, more like a boomerang.  and to me there were definite points of light.

macdill airforce base is not that far from here, so it may have been some kind of craft from there, but it was nothing i have ever seen fly over before this, day or night.
content.summary: Boomerang shape with single row of lights on underside

content.detailedDescription: My boyfriend and i were outside across the street from his house talking with his neighbor. all the while i was looking up at how beautiful the clear night sky was. no fog, or clouds, and i could see a lot of the milky way. from the east(over the ocean) a super bright white light, round, and fifteen times the size of the brightest objects in the sky (stars), flew silently and somewhat bumping left and right(very slightly) to the west towards some low hills, as i saw it i told my boyfriend to look up, and we watched it move quickly toward a hill and it dimmed out into a red dot and dissapeared. it wasnt an airplane, there would have been a sound. it was lower than an airplane. his neighbor has bad vision so he only saw a bright blur. i knew i might be seeing something strange because i have seen "u.F.O's" before, only a few times, and nothing like this. the fact that it was silent, fast, bright as hell, and disappeared makes me think it wasn't "ours." i have an intrest in these and usually my eyes water when i see them but this one was warm and bright and felt different. i believe it was checking us out. i love astronomy and i have a good capability of knowing what i am looking at.
content.summary: Brighter than anything in the sky, a white light with no sound flew straight yet bumpily over my head

content.detailedDescription:
This case was reported to pete hartinger rufos roundtown ufo society in circleville,oh. i do their field investigations for them to relate to mufon.Ssd/fi connie mcnichols

as reported to rufos. we saw 2 lights changing from red, to blue, to white in the sky approximately 500-1,000' in the sky. it was moving in erratic patterns like a kite would.This happened on september 4th 2009
around 11:00pm in liberty township, just north of west chester ohio which is a suburb north of cincinnati.I was driving down yankee rd.Turning to milliken rd.So we (my wife and 14 year old daughter)watched it for 15-30 seconds as we approached the intersection.No one could explain or identify what we were looking at so i classify it as a ufo. it was weird enough that everyone was quiet until we got home and i wanted to go back and see it again and my wife was scared and told me not to.Crazy stuff.Wondering if anyone else reported seeing the same thing.
content.summary: 2 lights changing from red,to blue, to white 500-1,000' up in the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Ok, i will try to quote our actual conversation as much as possible since this just happend 1 hour ago.  the wind was blowing east to west.  me (derek), my girlfriend amber, and my younger cousin jordan, were standing outside of my home watching and feeling a large storm come in.  the lightning strikes were very close to my house and we could hear fire trucks leaving two stations.  seconds after another very close strike, amber points out to us there is a object in the sky to the north over the baseball fields across the street.   she said "hey guys, what is that?". me and jordon look over and see the object. it was dark in the middle and seemed to get lighter at the edges.  it looked football shaped.  our best estimate is that it was 500 yards away.  it seemed to slightly bigger than a helicopter.  we watched for 15-20 sec. in silence then amber says "that's not a helicopter..." and then i said, "and its not a plane". my cousin said something like "holy crap dude" and we watched again.  we then notice that the area around this object seems kind of hazy, or wavy.  it looked like there was some kind of energy around it.  we all confirmed that to each other but i can't remember what we said.  this is when it seemed to start changing shape.  about 1 min after we all first see it, the object started to wane like the moon on the right side, which would be east side from our viewpoint.  the sky was completely overcast because of the storm, grey and and lighter grey shades over the whole sky.  the area that seemed to disapear was the same color as the sky.  it then moved into the middle of the object and created a horseshoe shape. a crescent with the opening at the top.  the spot then moved up and to the left, which is the west side from our viewpoint.  the object is now back to its original shape.  we all get very excited at this point and we have been watching now for 2:30.  my cousin says i should get a camera.  i hesitate for about 30 secs and watch the object inestead.  the whole time it has been moving from east to west at a constant rate.  it was climbing in altitude slightly as it moved.  it had been dirctly north when we firts seen it, and by now it had moved to north west of our view point.  at 3min 15sec i decide to go grab my cellphone and take some pictures.  i run in and scramble to find my phone for about 20 secs.  when i get back outside my cousin jordon says it has started moving faster after i ran in to get my camera, and it did.  it was now far off in the northwest moving closer to due west, but still visible to our eyes.  i take 4 pictures as fast as i can, then i take a short video.  i take 1 more picture and stop to watch what little we can see still for the last 1min and 30 seconds until it moves into the overcast clouds to the west-northwest of our viewpoint.  then that was it.  we looked at the pictures i took and you can barely tell it is there.  its just a speck of pixels when you zoom in but i will send them to you just the same.  i can't even see the thing in the video.  i was just too late to take good pictures.  feel free to contact me if you need anymore info.  i am interested to know if anyone else reports this same object which is why i am reporting it.  thank you for your time,

derek milner
content.summary: 3 witness object that changes shape from football to crescent and back with energy field around it

content.detailedDescription: Riverfest is cincinnati's annual farewell to summer event highlighted by fireworks on the riverfront.  last night, a pyrotechnic skydiving team returned to begin the show with what i consider a spectacular night time display that could easily be witnessed as fiery or meteor like, controlled  unidentified flying objects.  the team has appeared many times in the greater cincinnati metro region including several other recent events this summer.  i have attached a brief video segment from last night's fireworks.  convincing, aren't they?  a second video can be seen here:  http://vids.Myspace.Com/index.Cfm?Fuseaction=vids.Individual&videoid=24406357
content.summary: Recent cincinnati metro area ufo reports.

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i were up at about between 4:30 am to 6:00 am this morning 9-7-2009 and we saw in the east sky a large pulsating sphere. it was very bright and in constant motion. it looked very close as if it was in our atmosphere not in space like a star. we had a great view with my husbands scope. i'll do my best to describe it.

 it was a large round ball contantly turning, sometimes it would turn and have a flat bottom and round top or flat side and round on the other side, like i said it is constantly in motion, but yet hovering. i took pictures with my digital camera and two of the pictures look like its a planet, but the rest of the pictures were streams of light. every image is a different stream of light or some type of symbol. i thought there was something wrong with my camera so i shot a couple of other things and there was no stream of light. every time i shot at this ball of light, it was a different stream of light or symbol. i am not sure what this is, as i am no expert on anything relating to the sky. i have 25 pictures if you are interested. i would really like to know what this is if anyone has an opinion. star, satellite,planet,comet,ufo, i just don't know. thanks.
content.summary: Sphere constantly in motion, but yet hovering and also changing shape periodically.

content.detailedDescription:
Alright start to finish.  first around sunset (i watch alot of sunsets at work); i noticed a high amount of plains flying around, even over known no fly zones.  they were all flying in random directions, but remarkably resemble sweeping the air by grid.  i paid no heed to it, because it is an american holiday weekend (labor day).  anyway, going on... i went home that night and on one of my ciggorette breaks at 2033pst i saw a fireball that resembled the phenix lights almost directly to the west of me, and about 35deg high from horizon and never seemed to move.  i was in my robe and my camera was in my car so i didn't take pictures (plus it was fairly far away).  "he fireball looked to change between 3 colors white, blue and orange.  i had a cigorette about 45 minutes later and it was gone, with a new one about the same distance and height to the north with the same color changing properties.  still didn't move.  anyway at 1157pst i was going to bed with my window open and all of a sudden "plane shaped" lights appeared in my window not too far off the ground.  it was not out of the ordinary for planes to be flying low (there is a small airport about 45mi to the south and down about 2000 ft into a valley).  what struck me as odd was how i did not have any sound at all as it should have passed over my head.  alright, so i decided to call it a plane until it started hitting a treeline accross the street and two flashing lights (probably jet strobes) came rushing in from the west and the ignored craft seemed to hurry down past the trees.  the jet lights followed toward and disappered behind the trees.

at this point i think that the "triangle craft" is just a plane, just a really slow one which would account for me not hearing the noise.  although what really troubles me is what happoned afterward.  i was raised in a metropolitan area and have seen helicopters with spot lights follow cars and people in all types of areas.  i saw a plane through my window flying northwardly around the 101 with a spot light pointed from the aft of the plane pointing upward doing slow sweeps around.  this is when i knew everything was not normal about the evening.  i ran outside, and by the time i got to the front the planes search light seemed to be off.  the night was abnormally clear because of good winds that suddenly started around 1700pst that evening and it was a beautiful night.

i would not suggest in investigating this claim unless others report seeing odd behavior as well.  oh, and i was texting someone in atascedero and she saw the balls as well (but nothing else)
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: 2 fireballs, triangle craft, and strange behavior of piolets

content.detailedDescription: I was working, i work for a local taxi service.  i was taking a customer from medina to brunswick ohio at 9pm on sunday september 6,2009, . as we approached the intersection of fenn rd, and pearl rd (42), my customer said "dude, what the hell is that" i pulled over in a empty parking lot. we both got out of the vehicle, when i looked up, the best description i can give is, 7 to 10 of these glowing orange balls of light were traveling from east to west fairly slowly. these things were very high up, the only reason i am sure of this was because they seemed to be in the clouds,the clouds made a very hazy circle around them, they were in a weird pattern. there were 3 objects that made a straight line, then directly behind them was four more in an almost triangle shape,there were two seperate lights from the pattern one was about 100 feet or so off the back and 1 was a lot higher than the rest and was the last to dim out. the customer who was with me was just as shocked as i was. the line of these things was huge i can guess that it was about 300 feet long, maybe more. we watched them for about 3minutes before i realised i had my camera phone on me. i video taped them on my camera phone for about another 2 minutes and 30 seconds. as they moved west they seemed to just fade out, or dim out. but i just was not sure if it was from moving through the clouds or if they just vanished . i was very excited and kind of weirded out by the whole thing.I never have seen anything like that.
content.summary: 7 to 10 fire colored spheres in a pattern, east to west.

content.detailedDescription: My son and i were visiting my sister in southington.  their neighbors invited us over for a bonfire around 9:30-10ish pm.  we were sitting around the bonfire, and, all of a sudden this orange ball started going over us.  at first we thought it was a plane, but, then realized it wasn't because of the speed and, just the way it was flying didn't seem like a plane, nor did the color.  then, it was gone.  a couple of minutes another one came by and just as it was above us, it shot straight up in the air leaving an orange trail of some sort.  we were absolutely amazed.  then, when the third one appeared my sister got her camera phone out and videotaped it.  same thing, was there one minute, and, shot out of nowhere into space in an instant.  but, she did get it on video and when she sent it to my computer email and i showed my husband and my other son, they were absolutely in awe!  the exact same thing happened in our neighborhood about 2 weeks ago.  we were coming home from somewhere around 10ish at night, and, all of our neighbors were outside telling us what we had just missed.  it was exactly the same thing as what my son and i witnessed on sept. 6th.  at that time, we thought they were nuts, but, have now come to realize that they were not!  i'm glad we got to witness something like this.  it really makes you think and wonder just who is out there besides us on earth!
content.summary: Small orange circle, 3 separate times

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i had just come out of the publix grocery store at the intersection of highway 53 and jeff road, about 8 to 10 miles north-northwest of huntsville al. after we had loaded our groceries into the car, i was facing west and noticed a group of red and white lights slowly moving from north to south at treetop level. it appeared to be no more than a mile away. some of the lights were blinking, we could not see any structure between the lights and it did not make any sound. at first i thought it must be an airplane, probably approaching the huntsville airport which is probably 15 miles away. my wife and i watched it for approximately 3 minutes as it drifted at a speed that seemed much too slow for an airplane. at one point it almost appeared to stop just before it descended behind the tall trees on the west side of hwy 53. it also appeared to be quiet a bit larger than an airplane maybe 3 or 4 times the length of an average passenger jet. it had more lights than i expect to see on a single plane maybe 6 to 8 lights. if it was more than one plane, they would have been flying extremely close to one another and in a fixed relationship.  the lights were blinking at varying intervals. my wife noted that the lights appeared too large for airplane lights. after it disappeared we drove south along hwy 53 for about a mile but we did not see it again. the things that make this event so odd are the very slow speed, the apparent large size, and silence.
content.summary: Observed a formation of lights slowly drift along and disappear behind trees

content.detailedDescription:
at 6:30 pm, on dec.23 2007, i had stepped out onto the entrance landing at the finger docks area, where i was assigned as my job pick. i had a mug of coffee and lite a cigarette, it was around dusk, and i was curious if i might see holmes 17-p, so i leaned out so i could see the furthest towards the north east and maybe see it. no luck; anyway as i was panning my view from the northeast towards the east, i did a double take. it looked like a ornament suspended in the clouds. my first guess was that an air liner was aiming directly towards me,but that was not right. the object was a sphere with a solid black{?} band through the center with reticular boxes spaced above the black line. it did not have wings ,nor engines visible, also i saw no tail assembly dorsal/ vertical lift wings. i spent 10 years in the navy as an o.S.,the last four at nato.
i have a fair, to better than average knowledge of aircraft recon. this did not match anything i recalled. this craft did not seem to advance or withdraw, it merely sat there for 7 mississippi, then it was gone. it did not move off at a high rate of speed, it simply vanished.
   the question what did i think, very strange. i was not frightened, nor alarmed, i don't know why, but around six mississippi i raised my mug in salute and waved. after the event finished i turned around and drew what i saw on a sign attached to the wall at the entrance landing .Its still there as of today. its not much of a story, on a weird ending note; i drafted a letter to one of the ufo mags, telling this event and some other strange past event, anyway as i hit send to transmit, my e=mail was not sent to the ufo mag. but wound up at the www.Sen.Gov.Senator specter.Com or something like that, well thats all.
content.summary: At work/ having smoke outside/see saturn like off white object /7 sec's observed / gone.

content.detailedDescription: A very bright orange star, much larger than any craft in the sky traveling due north high above highway 377 (denton highway) stopped abruptly, then simply vanished.  odd because it was a sustained bright orange light, with the absence of telltale blinking airplane lights.  it stopped mid-sky and vanished.  no slow dimming, just completely gone, as it the light was extinguished.  there were no clouds in the sky to obscure the object. the obect arced, stopped then vanished.  i watched it for about 3 minutes, it had no sound.
content.summary: Very bright orange light, non-blinking. not a shooting star!

content.detailedDescription: First off i just want to say that this incident is the second ufo i have witnessed.  the first was in 2000 or '01 and myself and 4 others witnessed a huge triangle object very close to the ground near burns flat afb.  since that sighting i have been an avid skywatcher but it took 8 years untill i saw something truly unidentifiable.  on the evening of dec. 24  '08 (christmas eve) i was traveling north on rockwell ave  between nw expressway and britton rd. heading to meet family for the holiday and i happened to notice a starlike amber light at about a 40 degree angle directly in front of me almost directly in line with rockwell which runs north and south.  now my first impression when i noticed the light was that it was a light on an airplane coming in for a landing at wylie post airport which is 2-3 miles to my southwest from the location i witnessed the lights and i remember thinking the plane had mud or dirt inside the light because of the amber color without any glare or flicker, but the color was just so strange i kept looking while driving north and in just a few seconds after first seeing the light a smaller light of exactly the same color and with no glare or flicker whatsoever eminates from the first light.  the second light slowly falls to earth and when it appears to reach ground at the exact same instant the larger light in the sky winks out.  when i first saw the second light eminate out of the first light my heart jumped because i felt at that moment that i was witnessing a spark come from one of the small planes that land at wylie, until i noticed the light was identical to the larger one and fell too slow to the earth without losing any intensity of its light.  i pulled over in a store parking lot as soon as the second light reached the ground and the other winked out so i could see if  it indeed was an airplane but there was nothing there it was just like the light vanished.  even though the lights were starlike i had the impression that they were very close.  i stayed and watched that area of the sky for apprx 15 min without seeing so much as an airplane and i went to my family and told them of my experience, i was very excited.  i just cant believe nobody else in oklahoma city saw these lights but since ive been searching extensively for another witness but havent found one.  i hope these lights sound familiar to somebody else.   thank you mufon for letting me share my experience!
content.summary: On dec. 24 '08 i witnessed a starlike amber light over a large residential area and while watching a smaller light of same color eminates from larger light and fell slowly to the ground and as it appeared to hit the ground the larger light winked out.

content.detailedDescription: Almost every night, this star appears with different colors red, green, and white. through a telescope it looks like a sparkling jagged edge star,  then turns into a perfect circle, then a half circle. i took a photo with the camera looking through the telescope and this is what it shows. all of the other stars are white and not bouncing around like this one. you decide
content.summary: Every night

content.detailedDescription:
Around 9:20/9:25 pm on sept. 5th my buddy who lives with me left our house. he called me minutes later and told me to look out in the sky. i ran outside and looked to the west toward monroe/middletown, ohio. there were 2 glowing orbs hovering in the sky. they looked like giant fireballs around a third to a half the size of the moon. they werent too far above tree/ house level. within 10-20 seconds they changed. one of them got bigger streaked slightly to the left. when i say streaked it looked like someone just speared the light slightly. it looked as if it was coming toward me in a diagonal direction, as if moving southeast which would leave a steak that i could only see from the front. it did however stay relatively in the same place in the sky, just appearing to get larger and streak/smear slightly to the left. simultaneously the orb directly to the right looked as if it disappeared from the outside to the middle staying in the same spot. it fizzled and appeared to disappear into itself, like it was being flushed down a drain. i assume that it flew away in the opposite direction, causing it to appear to disappear into a point in the center. the other one then drifted out of sight, almost appearing to land but i could only see it disappear behind a house. a plane had been in the sky to the northwest and came toward me, then circled in front of me around the area in which it had disappeared, eventually heading back in the direction it came. i could clearly hear the plane but the only thing were loud pops unlike anything i have heard, but these were not often and did happen after it was no longer in sight.

these were definitely the largest thing i have seen in the sky in my life, other than the moon and sun. but they definitely looked like flames. and they were not similar to meteors i have seen. they stayed in one spot until they moved and/or changed irregularly. 


my buddy, before calling me, saw upwards of 6 of these all just hovering in the sky, not moving. he also said they looked like giant fireballs. and he said it looked as if white sparkles of some sort were dropping off of them. he then saw some of them disappear. he was in the car and called me and watched them as best as he could for the time we were on the phone. ill have him post his sighting.

my grandma watched one of these orbs to the south east of lebanon toward waynesville, ohio. she reported watching it for a good 10 to 15 minutes. it was around the general time of my sighting, more than likely before as she said it hadnt been dark long. she said it was like a big fireball flying around the sky. she described it as having a tail behind it, as if it was shooting fire out of it. but it flew in different directions not just from one point to another. it appeared to be throwing off blue and red sparkles. she did hear some kind of pops and did hear an engine noise but could not see a plane or anything else in sight. it eventually disappeared behind some trees.

my brother saw 6 similar fireballs in the sky in cincinnati tonight on the 6th and took a relatively useless pic but ill have him post his sighting and pic tomorrow as he is not home yet. he described them as flying around each other and disappearing and reappearing.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Big fireball like orbs to the west and south-east of lebanon, ohio

content.detailedDescription: I was staying at my mothers house on a lake in harshaw (oneida county, wisconsin), getting it ready for sale. i thought i had worked enough for the day and decided to try some fishing from shore. it was a beautiful evening. no clouds, no wind, 65 - 70 degrees. i was casting for whatever fish might come along, usually a bass and if i was lucky, a walleye. after i cast and as i am retrieving the bait, i am taking in the scenery and the sky. on one cast, i am looking at the sky and something caught my eye. it was a very bright light. it was almost directly overhead and moving slowly from roughly east to west. i have seen satellites countless times but never any this bright. i watched it for maybe 10 - 15 seconds at which time it just dimmed out. i kept watching on the chance that if it was a satellite, maybe it was tumbling and would reappear. it never did. no sound, no other lights, no vapor trail. it was a bright white light. to estimate the distance it traveled in relation to my outstretched arm, it would have been maybe 2 or 3 inches. i noted the time to be about 7:10p.M. i seemed to me that if it were a satellite, it still should be visible since the sun would still be shining on it. today (9/6) i tried to find out if there were any satellites crossing that area at that time on 9/4 but could find nothing.
content.summary: Very bright, moving slowly, roughly west to east, overhead, just dissapeared - no sound, no blinking lights

content.detailedDescription:
I have been watching two other glowing, multi-colored, extremely slow moving, lights for about a month now and i can't explain them either but,
on sept. 4, 2009 i had stepped out to see if the sky was clear and if these same lights were out. they were but, a white, flashing, moving, light caught my eye in the western sky. as i looked at it it didn't look like a plane but, i couldn't tell because of the distance. i ran inside, grabbed my sony dcr-trv18 120xzoom with super nightshot, and raced back outside. it was closer by now and i could see there were 3 bright white lights on the rear section of it and there seemed to be another white light at the front of it but it was difficult to capture at the angle and direction it was moving in. there was also a blinking light that was located under the object. it did not seem to have a set pattern to how often it flashed. it was a full moon, clear skies, and no noticeble wind, night which helped with what i witnessed. i was able to capture it in super nightshot, nightshot, and without nightshot. as it came closer i could see that it appeared to be in a triangular shape and had a very wide chem trail. it was completely silent. the only noise was the crickets and a couple passing cars. it was much lower in the sky than any commercial planes or jets. it almost seemed to be as high as a helecopter would be. at times the light on the bottom of the craft would blink a red color instead of white. it flew in a straight line towards town and appeared to be passing over town. i filmed it until it went out of sight and i did return back outside without my video camera later on to see if the chem trail was still there, up to an hour later it was still there.
we have no airports around this area that support large aircraft so when i do see them, day and night times, they are very high in the sky. i also have a neighbor who owns and flies his own plane from his corn field so i do see that plane and this did not match his plane either.
i have debated with myself whether to submit this because i know you have a very large number of cases.
i am a paranormal investigator with my own team and we have been together since 2001. i have shot thousands of hours of video, and taken thousands of photos, so i do have some background in videography and photography. i can promise you that the video i have has never been doctored in any way and can be tested to prove it.
i was totally caught off guard when this craft passed over my home and i am still amazed at the event.
i hope to hear from your organization soon. i do not want to put it on youtube or any other website without your scrutiny first. i will have to mail you a copy of the video because as soon as i put it on the computer the resolution is lost as well as the color. you can see the craft at times but not the chem trail and i feel you need the whole clip as it was seen in order to determine what it is. i will more than gladly either burn it to dvd or transfer it to another mini-dv tape and mail either one of them to you.

sincerely,
michelle hajdu
content.summary: Very low flying, triangular, strange chem trail, completely silent

content.detailedDescription: i was on my way home from work last night (spet. 5th) and was coming south on interstate 75 when off to my left i noticed a large, teardrop-shaped object appearing to come slowly down out of the sky. it was reddish-orange in color. as i continued to watch, it split into two distinct parts, also reddish-orange in color and teardrop shaped, but soon after splitting, winked out- whether due to cloud cover or something else. however, perhaps less than 20 seconds later, i began to see lights winking on, one by one, almost as if they were splitting from one another. these were not reddish-orange, but were more the color of lights one would expect from a helicopter; that is to say they were bright and had a white-yellow color to them. these objects appeared to also be moving downward at a slow rate while also spreading out a bit. i watched as they descended toward a tree line (as this was just after i had exited the highway at the springboro/franklin exit) and i attempted to drive down a side street which headed in the general direction of these objects to see if i could learn more. i soon lost sight of them, however, as trees blocked my view. i turned around and headed back the way i had come, and cannot be certain, but thought i heard the distant sound of a helicopter.
content.summary: Saw what i thought was a meteor or bomb or something falling

content.detailedDescription: Me and my friend were walking for our late night run. we walk to the middle school track for our run. we notice this bright golden color light, we thought start at first but then it came clear it was to close and bright. the walk from down the street to the track was about 5 minutes because we walk slow, and were also stopping occasionally to observe the object. there was this sphere like object that had a glow in the middle with a ring of light surrounding it. as the 5 minutes passed we notice the object move closer. my heart was racing and i made a run for it with my friend a little ahead of me. we seen the object fly over head some distance to the right i saw 4 lights on the bottom all evenly spaced apart making a plus sign. the object then disappeared into the horizon. however what makes me doubt it was anything special was the fact that i heard an engine sound to it. that still doesn't explain how it stood still in air for 5 minutes.
content.summary: Bright light in the sky stood in place for like 5 mins before flying overhead

content.detailedDescription: Hadnt had exercise for a number of days so i decided to take a short walk toward the airport in manteo, nc.  it was a pure black night and i couldnt see the road in front of me. as i came out from behind a large tree that lines the airport property i looked up and say a round yellow light with a thin gray uneven film on the surface moving to the left, slowly. the round light was bigger than a full moon but i could not make out the rest of the craft. as i said before the night was pitch black. i smiled and laughed, my heart jumped for joy because i had been looking for just such a sight ever since i have heard of ufo,s  i stood transfixed because i knew that this was the real thing and up close. i also knew what was transpiring within the ufo. they were punching in cordinates for their journey. as i watched the light became intensly white and i wiped my eyes, looked up again and that light was already almost out of sight. it took 3 seconds to disappear.It went directly east over the atlantic ocean. there was no sound at any time, it hovered perfectly still until it moved east. i have been down there on dark nights hoping to see another of the same but no luck. thank you for your time. robert john vernier   i felt very blessed that i had decided to take a walk that evening.
content.summary: Taking a late night walk toward the manteo airport passing a tree on the edge of the airport property i looked up at a light and i knew what it was.

content.detailedDescription:
I live in the garage apartment next to my parent's house. it was a little after 3 a.M. and my father let the dog out to use the bathroom. he was telling her to go out into the yard and i yelled out the window at him to say hello and to see why he was awake.  as we were talking, he pointed up in the sky and said, "look at that big star. i never saw a star so bright". my dad used to always joke with me when i was young and tell me that he saw ufos. i told him that he was goofy, but he begged me to go look at it, so i walked outside onto my front porch and there it was.  
it looked like the north star except brighter and more yellow. my dad told me to go get my digital camera so i did. at first i was scared to take pictures of it because i didn't want whatever it was to come down and get me like you see in the movies. my heart was beating fast and my hands were shaking. after a while, nothing happened, so i just kept watching it and taking pictures. i had trouble finding it at first because it kept moving. when i would place the screen up to the sky to find the object, two lights were visible. there were red and blue lights shaped in the form of a triangle and they kept moving around the bright "star". my dad and i couldn't believe what we were seeing because we liked to watch this sort of stuff on tv, but never imagined we'd see it in real life! to the naked eye, nothing was moving. when i put my camera up to it, the objects would move side to side and up and down very fast. my dad even went and got his telescope, but we couldn't find a visual because it kept moving. 
after about an hour or so, nothing else happened so we both went to bed. i went to bed about 5:30 a.M. and before i laid down, i felt a little freaked out, so i walked outside on the porch and it was still in the sky. i have not seen it since that night.  

in the pictures on my digital camera, you can see the red and blue lights around the object. if i were to zoom in on them, you could not see them anymore. i also noticed that there was another set of red and blue lights on the other side of the object. when i uploaded the pictures to my computer, the lights were no longer visible. i wish i would have kept them on my digital camera so i could still show people the lights. i have shown many people and every time i show them, they get freaked out. hopefully, maybe someone can lighten the pictures up or something so the red and blue dots show. also, the pictures of where it looks like a boomerang, i zoomed in as far as my camera would let me and i put the camera on "objects in motion". as you can see, the object changes ways. the other picture is just a plain zoomed in picture of it in motion.
content.summary: Hot summer night, 3-4 a.M., looked like north star but brighter. kept moving, and caught it in pictures.

content.detailedDescription:
I was headed to orange county to visit some family on saturday august 29, when i began to take pictures of the fires on the mountainside. i thought nothing of it until i went back and looked at the pictures. in one frame there was nothing there, but in the next frame maybe 3 seconds later, i noticed a very faint orange ballon shaped object.  it appears that this orange ballon had ripped through a part of the sky leaving a white trail behind it .

i only have one picture of the sighting
content.summary: Orange blimp shaped object sporrted over la crescenta
